results.title: A New path
results.creator_credit: Verity Hollingworth, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After realising that something was missing in her corporate job, Verity took a short term contract with Legacy and has been with them ever since. She talks about the care, diligence and passion of her fellow workmates and how working for Legacy has brought her closer to her own family and her family’s history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Verity Hollingworth, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: After realising that something was missing in her corporate job, Verity took a short term contract with Legacy and has been with them ever since. results.title: My journey
results.creator_credit: Michelle Johnstone, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Dad taught me about photography, cooking, Geelong Football Club and Legacy. Michelle tells of how she joined as a junior legatee and how being a member of legacy has given her the confidence in life and has helped her to become who she is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michelle Johnstone, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: Dad taught me about photography, cooking, Geelong Football Club and Legacy. Michelle tells of how she joined as a junior legatee and how being a member of legacy has given her the confidence in life and has helped her to become who she is today.

results.title: Ken's great times with Legacy
results.creator_credit: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Ken joined Legacy after his dad’s death. He went on the first Legacy camp in his early 20s and he shares with us his years with Legacy, the camps, day trips, boating adventures and the friends made over the years.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: In flux
results.creator_credit: Ryan Linfors, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Ryan joined Legacy, he was six years old and fatherless. Legacy taught him about acceptance and gave him three close friends. He tells of his relationship with Bec, Bear and Brad and how they have been there for him and have recently helped him in his decision to become a Legacy leader.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ryan Linfors, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.

results.title: Families and life
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.

results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.

results.title: Anne's Legacy
results.creator_credit: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Encouraged by her daughter, Anne, to get out there and keep busy, Dulcie started to volunteer. Through the volunteer work, Dulcie remembered her time at Legacy when she was 12 and decided to join up again. This restored her quality of life and brought her back in contact with the community that would provide support after Anne died.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dulcie Cedaro, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: Encouraged by her daughter, Anne, to get out there and keep busy, Dulcie started to volunteer. This restored her quality of life and brought her back in contact with the community that would provide support after Anne died.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.brief_description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
results.title_for_label: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [May 2009]
results.description: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.
description_for_label: Eleven Victorian war veterans tell about their experiences as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling workshop. They tell of their personal recollections of war being declared, signing up and their service during the war as well as remembering those who fought and the symbolism of the Shrine of Remembrance.

group_works.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White

results.title: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.brief_description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.
results.title_for_label: Memories of a mate: an interview with Ivor White
results.description: An emotional account by WWII veteran, Ivor White, about his involvement in the war in New Guinea and the tragic circumstances that brought about the death, on 14 July 1944, of his mate Jack Reynolds.
